etymologies: late Middle English (in the sense ‘sensory’): from Old French sensitif, -ive or medieval Latin sensitivus, formed irregularly from Latin sentire ‘feel’. The current senses date from the early 19th century

definitions: quick to detect or respond to slight changes, signals, or influences

examples.text: the new method of protein detection was more sensitive than earlier ones
spiders are sensitive to vibrations on their web

shortDefinitions: quick to detect or respond to slight changes or influences

definitions: easily damaged, injured, or distressed by slight changes

examples.text: the committee called for improved protection of wildlife in environmentally sensitive areas

shortDefinitions: easily damaged, injured, or distressed by slight changes

definitions: (of photographic materials) prepared so as to respond rapidly to the action of light.
shortDefinitions: (of photographic materials) prepared so as to respond rapidly to action of light

definitions: (of a market) unstable and liable to quick changes of price because of outside influences

examples.text: the Japanese were successfully entering many of the most sensitive markets

shortDefinitions: (of market) unstable and liable to quick changes of price because of outside influences

definitions: (of a person or a person's behavior) having or displaying a quick and delicate appreciation of others' feelings

examples.text: I pay tribute to the Minister for his sensitive handling of the bill

shortDefinitions: having or displaying quick and delicate appreciation of others' feelings

examples.text: I suppose I shouldn't be so sensitive

definitions: kept secret or with restrictions on disclosure to avoid endangering security

examples.text: he was suspected of passing sensitive information to other countries

shortDefinitions: kept secret or with restrictions on disclosure to avoid endangering security

definitions: a person who is believed to respond to occult influences.
shortDefinitions: person who is believed to respond to paranormal influences
